block.p: Kyle Judith Thomes, a daughter of Sheila and Russell Thomes of New York, was married yesterday to Richard David Love, a son of Alice and John Love of Stanardsville, Va. Henry Basayne, a minister of the Humanist Society of Friends, officiated at the California Alpine Club on Mount Tamalpais in Mill Valley.

Ms. Thomes, 32, is keeping her name. She designs educational projects for corporate clients of DigitalThink, an Internet company in San Francisco. She graduated from Hamilton College. Her mother is the marketing director of Swanke Hayden Connell, architects in New York. Her father is a marketing director for Peconic Landing, a developing retirement community in Greenport, N.Y.

Kyle Judith Thomes, a daughter of Sheila and Russell Thomes of New York, was married yesterday to Richard David Love, a son of Alice and John Love of Stanardsville, Va. Henry Basayne, a minister of the Humanist Society of Friends, officiated at the California Alpine Club on Mount Tamalpais in Mill Valley.

Ms. Thomes, 32, is keeping her name. She designs educational projects for corporate clients of DigitalThink, an Internet company in San Francisco. She graduated from Hamilton College. Her mother is the marketing director of Swanke Hayden Connell, architects in New York. Her father is a marketing director for Peconic Landing, a developing retirement community in Greenport, N.Y.

Mr. Love, 35, is a merchandise planner for Gap Inc., the retail chain based in San Francisco. He graduated from Virginia Commonwealth University. His father, a retired geodesist, made geographic measurements for the National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration in Silver Spring, Md. The bridegroom's mother, a registered nurse, does administrative consulting on long-term nursing care in Charlottesville, Va.
